name: Dr. Cagri Kilic
bio: Specializes in state estimation and navigation for planetary exploration robots.

name: Tuba Girgin
bio: Researches autonomous robot learning using reinforcement learning, graph neural networks, and deep learning. Enables robots to acquire locomotion, navigation, and manipulation skills. Experienced with ROS 2, Isaac Sim, and Unitree Go2 platforms.

name: Emre Girgin
bio: Researches uncertainty quantification for space robotics at the intersection of deep learning, computer vision, and safety-critical state estimation. Develops methods to convert deep model confidence into rigorous covariance matrices for lunar and Martian environments.

name: Akash Joseph
bio: Researches geometric mechanics and cislunar astrodynamics. Studies orbit families (NRHO, DRO, axial orbits) using symplectic methods, manifold geometry, and Poincaré sections for low-energy trajectory design and CubeSat deployment strategies.

name: Leia Spaniak
bio: Researches autonomous space systems with emphasis on perception for lunar applications. Develops uncertainty-aware terrain classification and trafficability assessment for lunar South Pole using semantic segmentation and probabilistic mapping.

name: Jasmine Nakladov
bio: Develops unified control frameworks for spacecraft-manipulator missions. Integrates Differentiable MPC with Reinforcement Learning for disturbance compensation and satellite stability in Earth and cislunar space.

name: Jose Castelblanco
bio: Develops autonomy and sensing systems for mobile robots with focus on space and planetary field robotics. Research spans ROS 2 autonomy stacks, edge computing, and multi-sensor pipelines, with validation on quadruped platforms in unstructured environments.

name: Benjamin Heckel
role: Research Assistant – Undergraduate Student in Aerospace Engineering (Accelerated bachelor's to master's)
bio: Space Robotics researcher focused on bio-inspired end-effector design to improve robotic mobility in planetary environments.

name: Dheer Chhabria
role: Research Assistant - Undergraduate Student in Aerospace Engineering with a Minor in Computer Science
bio: Space Robotics researcher focusing on quadruped robotics and developing their electronics, as well as the development and implementation of various sensor systems.

name: Haitish Gandhi
role: Undergraduate Researcher – Student in Aerospace Engineering Honors, with minors in Computer Aided Design/Manufacturing and Applied Mathematics.
bio: Researching different locomotive methods in space robotics and working on integrating a quadruped and quadcopter into one hybrid locomotion used for planetary exploration. Project name: HyDroQuad.

name: Nicolas Bonasoro
role: Research Assistant – Undergraduate Student in Aerospace Engineering with an Associate Degree in Applied Science – Business Administration
bio: Undergraduate Aerospace Engineering student researching lunar terrain operations and autonomous navigation. Work includes lunar habitat design, terramechanics, rover path planning and excavation, and improving safety in space operations.

name: James Hudson Kirk
role: Research Assistant - Undergraduate Student in Aerospace Engineering
bio: Orbital debris researcher focusing on optical detection and tracking of sub-10cm debris. Experienced in sensor design, orbital mechanics, and space situational awareness.

name: Kylie Nager
role: Research Assistant – Undergraduate Student in Aerospace Engineering
bio: Systems-oriented CubeSat resilience researcher focused on advancing the reliability and robustness of CubeSat design to ensure mission success through architecture, estimator-aware fault management, and V&V, applicable across subsystems.

name: Jose Walker Demedeiros
bio: Space Robotics researcher focusing on mixed sensor integration for spatial mapping and awareness including quadrupeds, rovers and micro-drones.

name: Payton Miller
bio: Orbital mechanics researcher specializing in lunar satellite station-keeping strategies. Focuses on spacecraft control techniques in cislunar environments using ANSYS STK.
